page.title: 14Mr. Harold Walker.
page.content: Mr Harold Walker M.P. P.C.lives in Grange Road in a bungalow next to South Cantley First School.His job is {deputy speaker}in the{House of Commons and the{chairman of ways and means.}He has a very busy life in the House of Commons.At 10.30 a.m. the session begins with prayers. Occasionally the M.P.s stay up all night asking questions.Mr Harold Walker has a lot of letters about 50-60 a day.He returns to Doncaster only at weekends. He has his own special office. In the Debating Chamber M.P.s ask questions. There are four places where they can eat. The Dining room where they have waitress service,a cafe,a tea room,a smoking room,a bar and one for Stranger's that come in and a Stranger's Dining room and a Stranger's Cafe.
